title: Igor Davidenko, Yaroslav Kesler - Book of Civilization
description:
Preface by Garry Kasparov


History as seen from the perspective of technological progress (becasue we all know that you can't cut limestone with copper saws...)


Some of the themes broached in the paper version of the book:

When did Dante, Petrarch & Boccaccio live and work?
Iron Rosette of the Etruscans
The Hittites
Iron dagger of Tutankhamen
Jericho hat in Moscow Kremlin
Timur Leng / Timburlain
Making steel
First boats
Did people make boards 5000 years ago?
The concrete Appian way
Cheops pyramid is made of concrete
The problem of dating antiquities
The time of the Pompei fall
Some suspicions about the "Tartar-Mongolian yoke"
The sources of Christianity
Hollow column of Trajan
The antique buildings in the Crimea
